task.title: Reattach The Drawband
task.shortdesc: Whether your drawband has come loose, you are replacing your drawband, or have made repairs to the mainspring, you will now need to reattach the drawband to the spring barrel.

step.cmd: Slide the carriage all the way to the right hand side.
Locate the end of the drawband, ensuring it is still knotted or has a hooked end.
Rotate the mainspring barrel towards the right side of the carriage to build tension and hold it there. Three to four full rotations should suffice.
Insert the drawband into the hole in the mainspring barrel.
Slide the drawband into the thin barrel slot.
Release the mainspring barrel slowly, keeping the drawband in line with the barrel until it is fully released.
If there is slack in the drawband, the barrel did not have enough tension. Remove the drawband and try again, rotating the barrel a few more times.
